intro: Malleostemon decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive malleostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of hairs. It is typically found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
